Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup, offset inside; interior glazed black; exterior: lip glazed; below, black-figure decoration consisting of branches overhanging uncertain domed, incised stippled object, possibly part of a bird or an animal.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B601.40)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0578) (Phase 1)
